content: I can't make it to the meeting today, or I may show up late
I can give a brief update on a few things:

• @tmandry and I spent quite some time going over all of the status quo stories yesterday -- about 2.5 hours, actually -- and we assembled a kind of "meta-narrative" that I plan to clean up and open as a PR

• There's a writing session later this afternoon and I have to think what would be best to focus on -- we had a really productive shiny future sketching session earlier this week, maybe try to continue with some of those themes.
• I left a few mentoring instructions here and there
@WG-async-foundations okay, time for our meeting
First, any announcements?
Niko left some updates above
I'm pretty excited to have a meta-narrative to tie together the status quo stories.
Have a conflict today, but will catch up with the chat after
meta narrative? got a link?
I should say, it's not too late to write new status quo stories
not yet, I think @nikomatsakis was going to open up a PR
I think I finally have time to start work on the #[must_not_await] implementation. I will start working on it from this weekend.
If no one has anything else, I think we can move on to triage
there's only one issue, so hopefully it's quick :)
unused_assignments false positive in async blocks #84292
seems to have a fix already
not much to do here, then
marking as triaged
okay, I want to leave time for other vision doc updates, if people have them
vision doc

nikomatsakis said:

  • There's a writing session later this afternoon and I have to think what would be best to focus on -- we had a really productive shiny future sketching session earlier this week, maybe try to continue with some of those themes.

I wasn't able to make the ones earlier in the week but I'm excited to go to this one
the only sort of update from me is that turning https://hackmd.io/Am72aqbhQsOCQF9Sw_7-Ww into a status-quo story is still on my todo. Just didn't get around to it yet. Hopefully tomorrow
I lost the link to the previous shiny future writing sessions, was anyone here for those?
Guess not :)
can't find it :(
well I wanted to open it up for suggestions on topics to explore
personally I have been thinking about the problem of writing Send + Sync + 'static bounds everywhere
other than topics from status-quo stories?
well, I think they should come from status quo stories
but there are a lot to choose from :)

Sean McArthur said:

meta narrative? got a link?

actually, I can share the notes we took
if you read the top 1-2 levels of bullet points, you get a sense for the overall narrative
it's a little pessimistic in that it focuses on only the negatives today :)
but that's why we're doing this, of course
"woe is us, those suffering the async death of the universe"
because we want to improve things
anyway, that might be a good place to mine for ideas
I think we can continue that discussion outside the meeting itself though, in writing sessions
otherwise I think we can wrap up
unless anyone has more topics for discussion
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
all right, glad we were able to have a quick meeting today
thanks everyone :wave:

Small question: I hate to bring up scheduling, and I know meeting times will always be inconvenient for someone, but this meeting starts at 7pm CEST on Fridays which is very hard for me (and I imagine many of those in Europe to make). If the meeting time has been discussed at length already, I'm fine to leave it, but I wanted to voice some small concern.
I'm fine to adjust the time of the meeting
